verses.verse: And the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> to Moses, <WH4872> Speak <WH559> to the priests <WH3548> the sons <WH1121> of Aaron, <WH175> and say <WH559> to them, There shall none <WH3808> be defiled <WH2930> for the dead <WH5315> among his people: <WH5971>

But for his kin, <WH7607> that is near <WH7138> to him, that is, for his mother, <WH517> and for his father, <WH1> and for his son, <WH1121> and for his daughter, <WH1323> and for his brother. <WH251>
And for his sister <WH269> a virgin, <WH1330> that is near <WH7138> to him, which <WH834> has had <WH1961> no <WH3808> husband; <WH376> for her may he be defiled. <WH2930>
But he shall not defile <WH2930> himself, being a chief <WH1167> man <WH1167> among his people, <WH5971> to profane <WH2490> himself.

They shall not make baldness <WH7144> on their head, <WH7218> neither <WH3808> shall they shave <WH1548> off the corner <WH6285> of their beard, <WH2206> nor <WH3808> make any cuttings <WH8296> in their flesh. <WH1320>

They shall be holy <WH6918> to their God, <WH430> and not profane <WH2490> the name <WH8034> of their God: <WH430> for the offerings of the LORD <WH3068> made by fire, and the bread <WH3899> of their God, <WH430> they do offer: <WH7126> therefore they shall be holy. <WH6944>

They shall not take <WH3947> a wife <WH802> that is a whore, <WH2181> or profane; <WH2491> neither <WH3808> shall they take <WH3947> a woman <WH802> put <WH1644> away from her husband: <WH376> for he is holy <WH6918> to his God. <WH430>

You shall sanctify <WH6942> him therefore; for he offers <WH7126> the bread <WH3899> of your God: <WH430> he shall be holy <WH6918> to you: for I the LORD, <WH3068> which sanctify <WH6942> you, am holy. <WH6918>

And the daughter <WH1323> of any <WH376> priest, <WH3548> if <WH3588> she profane <WH2490> herself by playing the whore, <WH2181> she profanes <WH2490> her father: <WH1> she shall be burnt <WH8313> with fire. <WH784>

And he that is the high <WH1419> priest <WH3548> among his brothers, <WH251> on whose <WH834> head <WH7218> the anointing <WH4888> oil <WH8081> was poured, <WH3332> and that is consecrated <WH3027> to put <WH3847> on the garments, <WH899> shall not uncover <WH6544> his head, <WH7218> nor <WH3808> rend <WH6533> his clothes; <WH899>
Neither <WH3808> shall he go <WH935> in to any <WH3605> dead <WH4191> body, <WH5315> nor <WH3808> defile <WH2930> himself for his father, <WH1> or for his mother; <WH517>

Neither <WH3808> shall he go <WH3318> out of the sanctuary, <WH4720> nor <WH3808> profane <WH2490> the sanctuary <WH4720> of his God; <WH430> for the crown <WH5145> of the anointing <WH4888> oil <WH8081> of his God <WH430> is on him: I am the LORD. <WH3068>
And he shall take <WH3947> a wife <WH802> in her virginity. <WH1331>

A widow, <WH490> or a divorced <WH1644> woman, or profane, <WH2491> or an harlot, <WH2181> these <WH428> shall he not take: <WH3947> but he shall take <WH3947> a virgin <WH1330> of his own people <WH5971> to wife. <WH802>
Neither <WH3808> shall he profane <WH2490> his seed <WH2233> among his people: <WH5971> for I the LORD <WH3068> do sanctify <WH6942> him.
And the LORD <WH3068> spoke <WH1696> to Moses, <WH4872> saying, <WH559>

Speak <WH1696> to Aaron, <WH175> saying, <WH559> Whoever <WH376> <WH834> he be of your seed <WH2233> in their generations <WH1755> that has <WH1961> any blemish, <WH3971> let him not approach <WH7126> to offer <WH7126> the bread <WH3899> of his God. <WH430>

For whatever <WH3605> man <WH376> he be that has a blemish, <WH3971> he shall not approach: <WH7126> a blind <WH5787> man, <WH376> or <WH176> a lame, <WH6455> or <WH176> he that has a flat <WH2763> nose, <WH2763> or <WH176> any thing superfluous, <WH8311>
Or <WH176> a man <WH376> that is broken footed, <WH7667> <WH7272> or <WH176> broken handed, <WH7667>

Or <WH176> hunch back, <WH1384> or <WH176> a dwarf, <WH1851> or <WH176> that has a blemish <WH8400> in his eye, <WH5869> or be scurvy, <WH1618> or <WH176> scabbed, <WH3217> or <WH176> has his stones <WH810> broken; <WH4790>

No man <WH376> that has a blemish <WH3971> of the seed <WH2233> of Aaron <WH175> the priest <WH3548> shall come <WH5066> near <WH5066> to offer <WH7126> the offerings of the LORD <WH3068> made by fire: he has a blemish; <WH3971> he shall not come <WH5066> near <WH5066> to offer <WH7126> the bread <WH3899> of his God. <WH430>
He shall eat <WH398> the bread <WH3899> of his God, <WH430> both of the most <WH6944> holy, <WH6944> and of the holy. <WH6944>

Only <WH389> he shall not go <WH935> in to the veil, <WH6532> nor <WH3808> come <WH5066> near <WH5066> to the altar, <WH4196> because <WH3588> he has a blemish; <WH3971> that he profane <WH2490> not my sanctuaries: <WH4720> for I the LORD <WH3068> do sanctify <WH6942> them.
And Moses <WH4872> told <WH1696> it to Aaron, <WH175> and to his sons, <WH1121> and to all <WH3605> the children <WH1121> of Israel. <WH3478>
